title: US consulate opens in Bengaluru; Minister Jaishankar recalls efforts: ‘You get Bengaluru done, I’ll get Los Angeles’ - The Indian Express
summary:
US consulate opens in Bengaluru; Minister Jaishankar recalls efforts: ‘You get Bengaluru done, I’ll get Los Angeles’

Publication Date: January 17, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

After nearly two decades, the US Consulate in Bengaluru was inaugurated, marking an important development in US-India relations.

  • The consulate will not process visa applications initially, but plans to do so in the future.
  • It will operate from the USCS office until a permanent location is established.
  • Minister Jaishankar emphasized its significance in sectors like technology and space.
  • The establishment of the consulate was prioritized ahead of PM Modi’s state visit.
  • Garcetti highlighted Bengaluru's role as a hub for commerce, diplomacy, and technology.
“If you get Bengaluru done, I’ll get Los Angeles done.” – External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar

This consulate is expected to enhance collaboration between India and the US in various sectors and make it easier for residents to access visa services.
newTitle: US Consulate Opens in Bengaluru, Signifying New Era in US-India Relations

title: ‘Driver, guard were made company directors’: ED attaches Rs 443 Cr properties of ex-promoters of Kwality - The Indian Express
summary:
ED Attaches Rs 443 Cr Properties of Former Kwality Promoters in Fraud Case

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: Indian Express

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached properties worth Rs 442.85 crore connected to the bank fraud case involving Kwality Ltd under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

  • The attached properties include a farmhouse, residential properties in upscale areas, and various residential plots.
  • Investigations revealed that former promoters used dummy companies managed by their driver and security guard.
  • ED's investigation is based on an FIR regarding fraudulent activities worth Rs 1,400.62 crore.
  • Search operations previously conducted resulted in the seizure of cash and evidence relating to the fraud.
  • Luxury vehicles and frozen demat accounts linked to the accused were also discovered.
“The funds diverted through the stated modus was circulated, layered to conceal its origin and routed to different accounts as per the instructions of the promoters for purposes not intended by the banks.”

This extensive fraud investigation is likely to have significant repercussions for the involved parties, with assets being actively seized to recover defrauded funds.
newTitle: ED Attaches Rs 443 Cr Properties of Former Kwality Promoters in Fraud Case

title: No contradiction, says MEA after army chief’s remarks on situation on LAC - Hindustan Times
summary:
No contradiction, says MEA after army chief’s remarks on situation on LAC

Date: Jan 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

NEW DELHI: There is no contradiction in the positions taken by the external affairs ministry and the army regarding the situation on the Line of Actual Control (LAC), as stated by ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal.

  • Jaiswal emphasized that the “task of de-escalation remains to be addressed” in Ladakh.
  • He referred to a prior understanding between India and China regarding the withdrawal of frontline forces at key friction points.
  • The minister noted that terms of the disengagement agreement continue to hold in relevant areas of eastern Ladakh.
  • Prime Minister Modi and President Xi held talks to revive dialogue mechanisms and normalize bilateral relations.
“There is absolutely no contradiction between the positions taken.” - Randhir Jaiswal

This statement underscores the consistency in India's approach to managing its border tensions with China while emphasizing ongoing diplomatic engagement.
newTitle: No contradiction, says MEA after army chief’s remarks on situation on LAC

title: Donald Trump swearing-in event to be attended by Quad nations' foreign ministers: MEA - Hindustan Times
summary:
Donald Trump Swearing-In Event to Be Attended by Quad Nations' Foreign Ministers

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will represent India at the swearing-in ceremony of Donald Trump on January 20. The foreign ministers from the Quad bloc nations are expected to attend the event, as stated by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA).

  • The swearing-in ceremony will take place on January 20, 2025.
  • S Jaishankar will represent India at the ceremony, invited by the Trump-Vance Inaugural Committee.
  • Meetings with representatives of the incoming administration are planned during this visit.
  • Donald Trump won the presidential elections in November with 312 electoral votes.
  • PM Modi previously attended the Quad Leaders' Summit in 2024.
“On the invitation of the Trump-Vance Inaugural Committee, External Affairs Minister (EAM) Dr S Jaishankar will represent the Government of India at the Swearing-In Ceremony of President-Elect Donald J. Trump as the 47th President of the United States of America,”

This event marks a significant diplomatic engagement for India as it continues to strengthen relationships with Quad partners.
newTitle: Donald Trump Swearing-In Event to Be Attended by Quad Nations' Foreign Ministers

title: 'Direct CBI To Lodge FIR Against Justice Shekhar Yadav': 13 Senior Advocates Write To CJI Sanjiv Khanna - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Direct CBI To Lodge FIR Against Justice Shekhar Yadav: 13 Senior Advocates Write To CJI Sanjiv Khanna

Date: January 17, 2024 Source: Indian Express

In a significant letter, 13 senior advocates of the Supreme Court have requested Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna to take action against Justice Shekhar Yadav of the Allahabad High Court for remarks made in a speech that they classify as hate speech, demanding a CBI investigation.

  • The letter claims Justice Yadav's speech undermines judicial impartiality and constitutional values.
  • Advocates cite Yadav's inflammatory comments made at a public gathering organized by the VHP.
  • Concerns are raised about Justice Yadav's past, including opposition to his appointment by former Chief Justice D.Y. Chandrachud due to extremist links.
  • Yadav reportedly made divisive statements regarding religious communities, promoting a majoritarian view.
  • Advocates demand that the CBI file an FIR against him following a Supreme Court ruling regarding judicial conduct.
“His use of the derogatory ‘kathmulla’ to refer to a section of Muslims is deeply disturbing,” the advocates stated.

The advocates emphasize the need for judicial independence and integrity, urging that such conduct cannot go unaddressed.
newTitle: Senior Advocates Urge CJI to Act Against Justice Shekhar Yadav for Hate Speech

title: Orissa High Court Bids 'Teary Farewell' To Its 34th Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Orissa High Court Bids 'Teary Farewell' To Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh

Date: January 17, 2024

Source: Live Law

The Orissa High Court held an emotional farewell for Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh on January 17, 2024, as he prepares to retire on January 19 after eleven months of leadership.

  • Justice Singh served as Chief Justice from February 7, 2024.
  • His leadership included significant contributions to renovating judicial infrastructure and addressing social issues.
  • Judges and Bar members praised his empathetic nature and commitment to justice.
  • He shared anecdotes reflecting his deep connection to Odisha and its culture during his farewell speech.
  • With his retirement, the High Court's strength reduces to 18 out of a sanctioned 33 judges.

“The craftsmanship in silver filigree and stone carvings showcases the artistic skills of the local artisans.” - Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh

Justice Singh's departure marks a significant transition for the Orissa High Court, leaving behind a legacy of compassion and dedication.
newTitle: Orissa High Court Bids 'Teary Farewell' To Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh

title: Centre revokes GRAP 3 curbs in Delhi-NCR amid dip in pollution levels - Hindustan Times
summary:
Centre revokes GRAP 3 restrictions in Delhi-NCR amid dip in pollution levels, says order

Date: Jan 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Centre's air quality panel has revoked the GRAP 3 restrictions in the Delhi-NCR due to improved air quality. This decision follows the earlier revocation of GRAP 4 restrictions.

  • GRAP 3 restrictions were revoked as pollution levels dipped.
  • Classes up to grade 5 will transition to hybrid mode.
  • Restrictions on BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel vehicles remain in place.
  • Pollution traditionally peaks during winters due to various local sources.
“As per the air quality and weather forecast provided by IMD/IITM, there is a likelihood of AQI to remain in lower end of the Very Poor category in the coming days owing to the favourable meteorological conditions and strong wind speeds,” said CAQM.

This change in restrictions is hoped to improve daily life while maintaining surveillance on air quality management as necessary.
newTitle: Centre Revokes GRAP 3 Restrictions in Delhi-NCR Amid Pollution Drop

title: Why Govt refused to hold NEET-UG 2025 online despite paper leak controversy - The Indian Express
summary:
Why Govt refused to hold NEET-UG 2025 online despite paper leak controversy

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

The Union government has decided to conduct the NEET-UG 2025 examination in a pen-and-paper format, despite previous controversies including a paper leak. This decision is rooted in logistical challenges and the significant proportion of rural candidates, who may not be familiar with online testing formats.

  • Despite recommendations to move to computer-based testing, the government reaffirmed the traditional format for NEET-UG.
  • This year, about 28 to 30 lakh candidates are expected to take the exam.
  • Logistical issues, such as accommodating large numbers of candidates and ensuring reliable testing centers, influenced the decision.
  • The large rural student base underlines concerns about equity in the transition to online testing.
“To hold an entrance test in an online format, we can accommodate about 1.5 lakh candidates in one shift,” said a source in the government.

While the government aims to eventually migrate to online testing, no immediate changes are planned for the current exam format. Additional measures to prevent future paper leaks are yet to be disclosed.
newTitle: Govt Maintains Pen-and-Paper Format for NEET-UG 2025 Amid Paper Leak Controversy

title: Bengaluru boy goes missing, found dead in pond near home - The News Minute
summary:
Bengaluru Boy Found Dead in Pond After Going Missing

Publication Date: January 16, 2023

Source: Local News Report

The body of a seven-year-old boy named Elvin D’souza was discovered in a pond near his home after he went missing, prompting an investigation into the circumstances of his death.

  • The boy was last seen on Thursday evening, January 16.
  • His parents reported him missing, leading to a search operation by local police.
  • Elvin's bicycle and slippers were found near the pond, indicating he may have drowned.
  • His body was recovered from the pond the following day.
  • The case has been classified as unnatural death, and investigations are ongoing.
The police are still verifying the exact circumstances of the incident.

This tragic event highlights safety concerns in local neighborhoods and the need for community awareness to protect children.
newTitle: Bengaluru Boy Found Dead in Pond After Going Missing

title: 12 Indians Fighting For Russian Army In Ukraine Killed, 16 Missing: Centre - NDTV
12 Indians working for Russian Army in Ukraine dead, 16 missing, confirms MEA - The Hindu
summary:
12 Indians working for Russian Army in Ukraine dead, 16 missing, confirms MEA

Published: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has confirmed that 12 Indians working with the Russian military have died, while 16 others are reported missing. Russia has communicated these details to India.

  • 12 Indians have been confirmed dead while working for the Russian military.
  • 16 Indians are reported missing, with efforts being made for their release and repatriation.
  • A total of 126 cases of Indian nationals serving in the Russian Army have been noted.
  • 96 Indians have returned to India and are no longer part of the Russian armed forces.
  • The Indian Embassy is involved in the repatriation of remains and treatment of the injured.
“The Russian side has categorised them as missing... We are seeking an early release and repatriation of those who remain.” - Randhir Jaiswal, MEA spokesperson

This situation highlights the ongoing risks faced by Indian nationals involved with foreign militaries amidst the conflict in Ukraine.
newTitle: 12 Indians working for Russian Army in Ukraine dead, 16 missing, confirms MEA

title: 16 Indians Fighting In Russian Army 'Missing', 12 Killed So Far In Ukraine War: MEA - News18
summary:
16 Indians Missing, 12 Reported Dead in Ukraine Conflict: MEA Updates

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: News18

At least 16 Indian nationals deployed by the Russian Army in Ukraine are currently missing, with 12 confirmed dead, as reported by the Ministry of External Affairs.

  • There are 126 Indian nationals known to have served in the Russian Army.
  • 96 of these have returned to India, with 18 still in service.
  • 16 are categorized as missing by Russian authorities, while 12 have died in the conflict.
“As of today, there have been 126 cases (of Indian nationals serving in the Russian Army). Of these 126 cases, 96 people have returned to India and have been discharged from the Russian Armed Forces.” - MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

The Indian embassy is working with Russian authorities to facilitate the repatriation of the deceased's remains and to assist those who are still serving.
newTitle: 16 Indians Missing, 12 Reported Dead in Ukraine Conflict: MEA Updates

title: Budget session of Parliament from January 31; Budget on February 1 - The Hindu
summary:
Budget session of Parliament from January 31; Budget on February 1

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The Budget session of Parliament will convene on January 31, 2025, and will be crucial leading up to the budget presentation on February 1.

  • The first part of the session will conclude on February 13, 2025.
  • The second part will resume on March 10 and continue until April 4.
  • President Droupadi Murmu will formally initiate the session with an address.
  • The Election Commission has advised against Delhi-centric budget announcements due to upcoming Assembly polls.
  • Opposition's strategy in Delhi elections may shape the Parliament's atmosphere.
“The deadline for the Joint Parliamentary Committee reviewing the Constitution amendment bills aimed at introducing simultaneous elections is also scheduled to present its report during the Budget session.”

This budget session is set against a backdrop of significant political events, and its outcomes could influence future legislative agendas.
newTitle: Budget session of Parliament from January 31; Budget on February 1

title: India approves over ₹10,000 crore funds to revive state-owned steel maker RINL - Mint
summary:
India Approves ₹11,440 Crore for Reviving Steel Maker RINL

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Live Mint

Introduction

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has approved a significant funding package of ₹11,440 crore to revive Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited (RINL), aiming to address its legacy issues and secure raw materials.

Key Points

  • The funding includes ₹10,300 crore in fresh equity and a conversion of a ₹1,140 crore working capital loan.
  • RINL is critical to India's steel sector, located strategically in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh.
  • The revival plan aims to modernize the plant and secure raw materials, benefiting employees and local economies.
  • Modi emphasizes the importance of Aatmanirbhar Bharat in the steel industry.

Notable Quotes

The Visakhapatnam Steel Plant has a special place in the hearts and minds of the people of Andhra Pradesh. During yesterday’s Cabinet meeting, it was decided to provide equity support of over Rs. 10,000 crore for the plant. This has been done understanding the importance of the steel sector in building an Aatmanirbhar Bharat.

Conclusion

This funding package marks a pivotal step towards revitalizing RINL, ensuring its future contribution to India’s steel industry and the region’s economy.
newTitle: India Approves ₹11,440 Crore for Reviving Steel Maker RINL

title: 'IIT Baba', Who Rose To Fame In Maha Kumbh 2025, Ousted From Juna Akhada: What Went Wrong? - Times Now
summary:
IIT Baba Ousted from Juna Akhada: What Went Wrong?

Date: 2025-03-15   Source: Times Now

The recent ousting of IIT Baba, a prominent figure at the Maha Kumbh Mela 2025, from the Juna Akhada has raised eyebrows within the spiritual community. Known for his fusion of modern intellect and ancient wisdom, Abhay Singh's rapid rise to fame led to allegations regarding discipline and adherence to Akhada traditions.

  • Abhay Singh, popularly known as IIT Baba, is a graduate of IIT Bombay.
  • He gained fame at the Maha Kumbh Mela but was ousted amid breaches of Akhada traditions.
  • Concerns over his social media popularity created friction within the Juna Akhada, traditionally strict about public appearances.
  • A senior saint noted changes in IIT Baba's demeanor and issues with focus and stability.
  • The Akhada's leadership directed him to retreat from social media to concentrate on spiritual growth.
"Real seekers focus on knowledge and their spiritual quest, not popularity," said a senior saint.

The episode has sparked discussions about the balance between modern fame and ancient traditions within spiritual communities.
newTitle: IIT Baba Ousted from Juna Akhada: An Overview of the Controversy

title: After JD(U) caution, BJP concern about Delhi poll blowback, Shehzad Poonawalla apologises to Purvanchalis - The Indian Express
summary:
BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla Apologizes to Purvanchali Community Amid Election Concerns

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: The Indian Express

A day after BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla made derogatory comments against AAP's Rituraj Jha, he issued an apology acknowledging the hurt to the Purvanchali community ahead of Delhi's Assembly elections.

  • The Janata Dal (United) emphasized the need for responsible speech and requested action against Poonawalla.
  • Poonawalla expressed heartfelt apologies on social media, aiming to mend relations with Purvanchalis, a key voting bloc.
  • Concerns arose within BJP about potential backlash from the Purvanchali community in the upcoming elections.
  • BJP's Manoj Tiwari condemned Poonawalla’s remarks, reaffirming the party's expectations for respectful discourse.
  • Arvind Kejriwal criticized the BJP for neglecting Purvanchali needs and misrepresentation.
“I apologise wholeheartedly to my Purvanchali brothers and sisters for the hurt that my comments have caused them.” - Shehzad Poonawalla

This incident raises questions about the BJP's image among Purvanchalis and could impact voter sentiment in the February elections.
newTitle: BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla Apologizes to Purvanchali Community Amid Election Concerns

title: Mangaluru: Armed gang robs Rs 15 crore worth gold, Rs 5 lac cash from Kotekar bank - Daijiworld.com
Mahakumbh 2025: Prohibitory orders issued till Feb 28 to safeguard law and order - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mahakumbh 2025: Prohibitory Orders Issued to Ensure Safety

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The additional commissioner of police in Prayagraj has announced the imposition of prohibitory orders from January 16 to February 28 during the Mahakumbh Mela to maintain law and order.

  • The orders come under section 163 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023.
  • They were passed without notice due to urgency, considering overlapping festivities and potential disruptions.
  • Prohibitory measures aim to prevent activities that can lead to disturbances, maintaining peace for various religious observances and examinations.
  • Specific restrictions include the ban on gatherings and protests without permission, restrictions on carrying weapons, and prevention of provocative speech.
"In view of the communal sensitivity... there is an urgent need to maintain peace." - Additional Commissioner of Police

This initiative underlines the importance of security during the Mahakumbh, ensuring that celebrations occur safely and without incident.
newTitle: Mahakumbh 2025: Prohibitory Orders Issued to Ensure Safety

title: Arvind Kejriwal calls Ayushman Bharat ‘biggest scam’ after SC stays Delhi HC order - Hindustan Times
summary:
Arvind Kejriwal calls Ayushman Bharat ‘biggest scam’ after SC stays Delhi HC order

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court has temporarily halted a Delhi High Court order that compelled the Delhi government to sign a memorandum of understanding with the Centre for the implementation of the Ayushman Bharat scheme. AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal criticized the scheme, calling it a 'scam' and expressed relief that the Supreme Court acknowledged its flaws.

  • Supreme Court stayed a High Court order demanding the Delhi government to sign an MoU for Ayushman Bharat.
  • Kejriwal referred to Ayushman Bharat as the 'biggest scam' in the country during a press conference.
  • The Delhi High Court previously directed the government to ensure the scheme's full implementation.
  • Kejriwal's comments arose after a Supreme Court notice to the Centre regarding the Delhi government's plea against the High Court's order.
“Ayushman Bharat is the biggest scam in the country. When the central government changes and an inquiry is conducted into these scams, people will realize how big a scam Ayushman Bharat truly was.” - Arvind Kejriwal

This ruling could have significant implications for the implementation of health infrastructure in Delhi and sheds light on the ongoing political tensions surrounding healthcare policies in the capital.
newTitle: Arvind Kejriwal Slams Ayushman Bharat as 'Biggest Scam' After Supreme Court Ruling

title: After flak, JD(U) caution, Shehzad Poonawala says sorry: ‘I apologise wholeheartedly to my Purvanchali brothers and sisters’ - The Indian Express
REET 2025 Admit Card To be Released Soon, Check Level 1 & 2 Paper Pattern and Other Exam Details - Pasteur Institute of India
summary:
REET 2025 Admit Card To be Released Soon, Check Level 1 & 2 Paper Pattern and Other Exam Details

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education will soon conduct the Rajasthan Eligibility Examination for Teachers (REET) to evaluate candidates who aspire to teach in Rajasthan from Classes 1 to 8. The exam is scheduled for February 27, 2025, and admit cards will be available from February 19, 2025.

  • The REET 2025 exam will be held in offline mode.
  • Candidates must download the admit card as it is essential for entering the exam venue.
  • The Level 1 exam is from 10:00 AM to 12:30 PM and the Level 2 exam from 3:00 PM to 5:30 PM on the exam day.
  • Subjects for Level 1 and Level 2 are outlined, with each paper designed as multiple-choice questions without negative marking.
  • It is crucial for candidates to verify their admit card details and address any discrepancies immediately.
The admit card is a mandatory document containing crucial information such as name, roll number, exam date, and guidelines for exam day.

The REET exam is a vital step for aspiring teachers in Rajasthan, ensuring that only qualified individuals are able to gain teaching positions.
newTitle: REET 2025 Admit Card Release and Exam Details

title: Arvind Kejriwal takes 'prasad by God' jibe at PM Modi over BJP manifesto: 'Say freebies not harmful' - Hindustan Times
BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla apologises for controversial remarks on AAP MLA's surname - The Times of India
China lauds ISRO on successful docking of satellites in space - The Tribune India
summary:
China lauds ISRO on successful docking of satellites in space

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: The Tribune

China has congratulated India's ISRO for successfully docking satellites in space, marking India as the fourth nation to achieve this milestone.

  • The two satellites were docked successfully under the SpaDeX mission.
  • China's spokesperson Yu Jing praised the achievement on social media.
  • India joins the US, Russia, and China as the only countries to have successfully docked satellites.
  • Previous acknowledgments from China include India's Mars Orbiter Mission in 2014 and moon landing accomplishments.
  • There is potential for cooperation between India and China in space exploration and technology.
“Congratulations to India #ISRO for successful docking of satellites under the SpaDeX mission!” - Yu Jing

This successful docking underscores the advancements both nations are making in space technology and the potential for future collaborative efforts.
newTitle: China Congratulates ISRO on Successful Satellite Docking

title: Filmmaker Ranjith moves Kerala High Court to quash sexual harassment case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Filmmaker Ranjith Moves Kerala High Court to Quash Sexual Harassment Case

Published on: 17 Jan 2025, 10:31 am

Malayalam film director Ranjith Balakrishnan has approached the Kerala High Court seeking to quash a sexual harassment case lodged against him by a Bengali actress.

Justice C Jayachandran issued notice to the State and the complainant, with the hearing set for January 27.

  • The complaint alleges Ranjith invited the actress to discuss a film but inappropriately touched her.
  • Ranjith claims the allegations are part of a conspiracy to remove him from his position as Chairman of the Kerala Chalachithra Academy.
  • He argues the complaint was filed beyond the limitation period, violating the legal timeframe for such cases.
  • Ranjith recently secured bail from the Karnataka High Court in a separate case against him.
  • This case is among several high-profile allegations following the release of the Justice Hema Committee Report, which highlighted systemic abuse in the Malayalam film industry.
Director Ranjith had earlier moved for anticipatory bail in the case which was closed by the Court, noting that the offence was bailable at the time of the alleged crime. More details: https://t.co/hd1KHQEWcT

The petition was moved by advocates Santheep Ankarath and Sherry MV.

This evolving situation reflects broader issues of sexual misconduct within the film industry.
newTitle: Filmmaker Ranjith Seeks to Dismiss Sexual Harassment Case in Kerala High Court

title: Delhi assembly elections: BJP's manifesto promises free cylinder on Holi & Diwali; Rs 21,000 to pregnant - The Times of India
summary:
Delhi Assembly Elections: BJP Promises Free Gas Cylinders and Financial Support for Pregnant Women

Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

An overview of the BJP's election manifesto for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections, highlighting key promises aimed at supporting families and women in particular.

  • Free gas cylinders for Holi and Diwali.
  • Financial support of Rs 21,000 for pregnant women.
  • Focus on welfare schemes to gain voter support.
“We are committed to the welfare of all families in Delhi,” a party spokesperson stated.

This manifesto reflects a strategic approach by the BJP to appeal to voters through social welfare promises in the run-up to the elections.
newTitle: Delhi Assembly Elections: BJP Promises Free Gas Cylinders and Financial Support for Pregnant Women

title: ED's opposition to bail is for election propaganda: Arvind Kejriwal to Delhi High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
8th Pay Commission: Minimum Basic Salary Of Central Govt Employees Likely To Rise Above Rs 40,000 - News18
summary:
8th Pay Commission: Minimum Basic Salary Of Central Govt Employees Likely To Rise Above Rs 40,000

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: News18

The Union Cabinet has approved the 8th Pay Commission, with the minimum basic salary of central government employees expected to exceed ₹40,000 per month from January 1, 2026.

  • The 8th Pay Commission aims to ensure competitive salaries alongside allowances and performance pay.
  • A fitment factor between 2.6 and 2.85 may lead to salary increases of 25-30%.
  • The current minimum salary under the 7th Pay Commission is ₹18,000 per month, which may rise to around ₹36,020 with allowances.
  • The recommendations of the 8th Pay Commission are set to be implemented in early 2026.
  • Periodic pay revisions are crucial to address inflation and maintain equitable remuneration.
“The 8th Pay Commission is pivotal in addressing evolving economic realities…” - Neeti Sharma, CEO of TeamLease Digital

This upcoming pay commission could significantly impact government employees' livelihoods, enhancing financial empowerment and boosting consumption in the economy.
newTitle: 8th Pay Commission: Minimum Basic Salary Of Central Govt Employees Likely To Rise Above Rs 40,000

title: Karnataka ATM loot: Robbers who shot dead two security guards in Bidar identified - Hindustan Times
summary:
Karnataka ATM Loot: Identification of Robbers Who Killed Two Security Guards

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara announced the identification of two robbers involved in the tragic shooting of two security guards during an ATM cash transportation heist in Bidar.

  • On January 16, two security guards were shot dead while handling ₹92 lakh cash intended for SBI ATM refilling.
  • The suspects were reported to have fled to Hyderabad after the incident.
  • Police are actively pursuing the suspects and have sent teams to Indore and other areas.
  • Home Minister stated that the robbers must have monitored the cash transportation process for a long time prior to the robbery.
  • During the robbery, assailants fired eight shots into the air to deter bystanders.
“Unfortunately, yesterday there was no gunman in the vehicle,” said the Minister.

The incident highlights the need for stringent security measures during cash transportation to prevent such tragic occurrences in the future.
newTitle: Karnataka ATM Loot: Identification of Robbers Who Killed Two Security Guards

title: Something fishy in ED: ASG tells Supreme Court after affidavit in bail case filed sans clearance - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Drama Over ED's Unvetted Affidavit in Bail Case

Published on: 17 Jan 2025, 9:39 am

The Supreme Court witnessed significant tension as it was revealed that the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) response to a bail application was submitted without proper authorization or vetting.

  • Additional Solicitor General (ASG) SV Raju stated that the affidavit was hastily filed, leading to calls for an internal inquiry into the ED's processes.
  • Justice Oka emphasized that the Advocate on Record should be held accountable for the affidavit's submission.
  • Raju later clarified that the Advocate on Record was not to blame and that the affidavit's issues stemmed from lack of proper review.
  • Senior Advocate Meenakshi Arora, representing the accused, argued for bail due to the lengthy detention of her client.
  • The case is set for further hearing on February 5.
“I smell something fishy. I have ordered a departmental inquiry in this case.” - ASG SV Raju

This incident highlights potential procedural shortcomings within the ED and raises questions about accountability in legal submissions.
newTitle: Supreme Court Drama Over ED's Unvetted Affidavit in Bail Case
